'''Vodafone Ghana''', formerly Ghana Telecom, is the national [[Telecommunication|telecom]] company of [[Ghana]]. In 2006 it had around 400,000 customers for fixed and mobile telephony and internet services.
On 3 July 2008, the sale of the company for $900m to [[Vodafone]] group was announced. After the transaction closed, [[Vodafone]] had a 70% stake in the company, while the [[Ghana]]ian government will retain a 30% stake.
On 16 April 2009, the company was rebranded as Vodafone Ghana.
